com.github.marceloleite2604.util.time.zoned

Class ZonedDateTimeUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.marceloleite2604.util.time.zoned.ZonedDateTimeUtil

  • public class ZonedDateTimeUtil
extends Object
    A series of handy methods which helps working with ZonedDateTime objects.
    Author:
    MarceloLeite2604
    See Also:
    GitHub project

      • now

        public ZonedDateTime now()
        Returns current time on predefined ZoneId.
        Returns:
        Current time on predefined ZoneId.

      • isBetween

        public boolean isBetween(ZonedDateTime date,
                         ZonedDateTime startInclusive,
                         ZonedDateTime endExclusive)
        Checks if specified date is between a time interval.
        Parameters:
        date - Date to check.
        startInclusive - Start time interval (inclusive).
        endExclusive - End time interval (exclusive).
        Returns:
        true if date is inside the time interval specified, false otherwise.

      • isBetween

        public boolean isBetween(ZonedDateTime date,
                         TimeInterval timeInterval)
        Checks if specified date is between a time interval.
        Parameters:
        date - Date to check.
        timeInterval - time interval to check.
        Returns:
        true if date is inside the time interval specified, false otherwise.

      • convertFromEpochTime

        public ZonedDateTime convertFromEpochTime(long epochTime)
        Converts an epoch time to a ZonedDateTime object.
        Parameters:
        epochTime - The epoch time to be converted.
        Returns:
        A ZonedDateTime object with time specified on epochTime parameter.

      • toString

        public String toString(ZonedDateTime zonedDateTime)
        Converts a ZonedDateTime object to a preformatted text.
        Parameters:
        zonedDateTime - Time to convert as text.
        Returns:
        The preformatted text elaborated from zonedDateTime parameter.

      • parse

        public ZonedDateTime parse(String text)
        Parses a preformatted text and convert it to a ZonedDateTime object.
        Parameters:
        text - Text to be parsed.
        Returns:
        A ZonedDateTime containing the date specified on the predefined text.

      • convertAsEpochTime

        public long convertAsEpochTime(ZonedDateTime zonedDateTime)
        Converts a ZonedDateTime to an epoch time.
        Parameters:
        zonedDateTime - Time to be converted
        Returns:
        The epoch time retrieved from the zonedDateTime parameter.

      • toSystemDefaultZoneId

        public ZonedDateTime toSystemDefaultZoneId(ZonedDateTime zonedDateTime)
        Converts a ZonedDateTime object to another ZonedDateTime object, but using system default zone id.
        Parameters:
        zonedDateTime - Time to be converted.
        Returns:
        A ZonedDateTime object with time informed on zonedDateTime parameter converted to system default zone id.

      • toDefaultZoneId

        public ZonedDateTime toDefaultZoneId(ZonedDateTime zonedDateTime)
        Converts a ZonedDateTime object to another ZonedDateTime object, but using the zone id specified on DEFAULT_ZONE_ID constant.
        Parameters:
        zonedDateTime - Time to be converted.
        Returns:
        A ZonedDateTime object with time informed on zonedDateTime parameter converted to this class default zone id.

      • toStringAsTimestamp

        public String toStringAsTimestamp(ZonedDateTime zonedDateTime)
        Converts a ZonedDateTime object to a preformatted timestamp text.
        Parameters:
        zonedDateTime - Time to convert as timestamp text.
        Returns:
        The preformatted timestamp text elaborated from zonedDateTime parameter.

      • convertFromWrittenTimestamp

        public ZonedDateTime convertFromWrittenTimestamp(String text)
        Converts a preformatted timestamp text to a ZonedDateTime object.
        Parameters:
        text - Text to be converted.
        Returns:
        A ZonedDateTime object with the time specified on text parameter.
